1.title: Cold Case #83-125: Donna Awcock
1.plot: In the premiere episode, the team investigates the 1983 murder of 17-year-old Donna Jean Awcock.

2.title: Cold Case #87-36: Margaret McWilliam
2.plot: The 1987 cold case murder of Margaret McWilliam is investigated.

3.title: Cold Case #01-04: David Buller
3.plot: The team investigates the gruesome murder of University of Toronto art professor David Buller,

4.title: Cold Case #69-52: Jacqueline English
4.plot: Following the death of a retired police detective, his son finds a treasure trove of information on the case he was obsessed with solving. Can the team unravel the cryptic clues he left behind and find her killer?

5.title: Cold Case #99-42125: Nadine Gurczenski
5.plot: The cold case murder of an exotic dancer is re-examined, while the daughter she barely knew hopes to find out why her mother never came home one night so many years ago.

6.title: Cold Case #82-96306: Patricia Roach
6.plot: The team reopens the investigation into the 1982 murder of a 26-year-old nurse.

7.title: Cold Case #99-510291: Clyde Frost
7.plot: In 1999 a murdered 80 year old man is left in the back of his van for days only to be found by a parking attendant. The case has been cold ever since, but now the team of amateur sleuths starts to shake things up .

8.title: Cold Case #68-160533: Lynda White
8.plot: A college student is brutally murdered and her parents have spent 45 years trying to keep the local police on the case.

imdb.plot outline: Each one-hour episode introduces a different crime, as Arntfield - a working cop and university professor with a PhD - and his team use fresh eyes and advanced tools in their quest to solve these longstanding mysteries and bring closure to the victims' families. Arntfield guides the six-member squad as they take to the field, seeking new leads and exploiting modern technology, discovering evidence that may help close the case. Capitalizing on the potential of 21st-century technology to unearth new information, Arntfield also relies on squad members to use their own skill sets - which run the gamut from medical biophysics to forensic anthropology to private investigating - and ways of thinking to move each case forward. To Catch a Killer takes viewers along on its mission, as the team interviews family members and witnesses, dissects evidence (old and new), visits long-forgotten crime scenes, and re-enacts potential scenarios ... as the cold-case clock ticks. How far will the team go in their quest to solve these murders? The result is a compelling, surprising, emotional and, ultimately, uplifting new television show, airing on OWN: Oprah Winfrey Network (Canada). Produced by Ocean Entertainment Ltd of Halifax, To Catch a Killer marks a new era in policing and solving crime ... and a new era in true-crime TV.
imdb.title: To Catch a Killer
plot: Police officer and professor Mike Arntfield leads a squad of tech-savvy civilians as they work to solve horrific cold cases in this episodic documentary drama.::Skana Gee, publicist

Each one-hour episode introduces a different crime, as Arntfield - a working cop and university professor with a PhD - and his team use fresh eyes and advanced tools in their quest to solve these longstanding mysteries and bring closure to the victims' families. Arntfield guides the six-member squad as they take to the field, seeking new leads and exploiting modern technology, discovering evidence that may help close the case. Capitalizing on the potential of 21st-century technology to unearth new information, Arntfield also relies on squad members to use their own skill sets - which run the gamut from medical biophysics to forensic anthropology to private investigating - and ways of thinking to move each case forward. _To Catch a Killer_ (qv) takes viewers along on its mission, as the team interviews family members and witnesses, dissects evidence (old and new), visits long-forgotten crime scenes, and re-enacts potential scenarios ... as the cold-case clock ticks. How far will the team go in their quest to solve these murders? The result is a compelling, surprising, emotional and, ultimately, uplifting new television show, airing on OWN: Oprah Winfrey Network (Canada). Produced by Ocean Entertainment Ltd of Halifax, _To Catch a Killer_ (qv) marks a new era in policing and solving crime ... and a new era in true-crime TV.::Skana Gee, publicist
